awd_titl_txt: Improving Access to the Human Osteology Collections of the  Peabody Museum
awd_abstract_narration: The human osteology collection housed at the Peabody Museum,                    Harvard University, is one of the largest and most important                    systematic collections of its type in the country.  It consists                 of over 15,000 individuals from well documented archaeological,                 medical, and forensic investigations.  These collections form a                 broad comparative resource for cross cultural research in                       physical anthropology.                                                                                                                                          The increasing demands on the collection by researchers and                     lack of adequate storage space have made it difficult to                        utilize these collections effectively.  To remedy this problem,                 museum personnel will reorganize and upgrade the storage                        facilities, conduct an inventory and conservation survey, and                   develop a computerized catalogue system.                                                                                                                        Human osteology collections are significant research resources                  because of the light they can shed on the changing                              relationships of culture and biology through human history.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
